intro: Blepharis somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia and Ethiopia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant is adapted to dry conditions, featuring succulent leaves that help store water. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as savannas and coastal dunes. Due to its resilience and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists studying drought-tolerant flora.
